name: California Consumer Privacy Act / California Privacy Rights Act

applicabilityChecks.description: Requires both California connection and qualifying threshold

conditions.description: Must meet at least one threshold

rules.message: Sensitive personal information requires explicit consent or falls under specific exceptions
rules.remediation: Implement consent mechanism for sensitive personal information or ensure processing falls under permitted exceptions

rules.message: Processing children's data requires opt-in consent and parental consent for under 13
rules.remediation: Implement age verification and opt-in consent for minors, parental consent for children under 13

rules.message: Sale of personal information requires prominent opt-out mechanism
rules.remediation: Implement 'Do Not Sell My Personal Information' link and opt-out process

rules.message: Cross-context behavioral advertising requires opt-out mechanism
rules.remediation: Implement 'Do Not Share My Personal Information' link and opt-out process

rules.message: Household data processing requires specific notice provisions
rules.remediation: Provide clear notice about household data collection and use

rules.message: Employee data may be subject to different requirements under employment context
rules.remediation: Ensure employment-specific privacy notices and rights are provided

consumerRightsAnalysis.description: System analyzes consumer rights compliance against CCPA/CPRA requirements
validationProcess: Check opt-out mechanisms for sale and sharing

assessmentQuestions.question: Do you conduct business in California or serve California residents?
assessmentQuestions.help: This includes any goods, services, or activities directed to California consumers

assessmentQuestions.question: Approximately how many California residents' personal information do you process annually?
assessmentQuestions.help: Include customers, employees, vendors, website visitors, etc. This helps determine CCPA applicability thresholds

assessmentQuestions.question: What is your business's annual gross revenue?
assessmentQuestions.help: CCPA applies to businesses with annual gross revenues over $25 million

assessmentQuestions.question: What percentage of your annual revenue comes from selling or sharing consumer personal information?
choices: None - we don't sell or share personal information
assessmentQuestions.help: Businesses deriving 50% or more of revenue from selling PI have lower consumer volume thresholds

assessmentQuestions.question: Which of these activities do you engage in?
choices: Sell customer lists to third parties
Share data with advertising partners for compensation
License customer data for commercial use
Share data for cross-context behavioral advertising
assessmentQuestions.help: These activities may constitute 'selling' or 'sharing' under CCPA definitions

assessmentQuestions.question: Which types of sensitive personal information do you collect or process?
choices: Social Security numbers or driver's license numbers
Financial account numbers or credit card information
Contents of mail, email, or text messages (where business is not intended recipient)
Sex life or sexual orientation information
assessmentQuestions.help: Sensitive personal information has enhanced protection requirements under CPRA

assessmentQuestions.question: Do you knowingly collect personal information from children?
choices: No, we don't collect from children
Yes, from children under 13 years old
Yes, from children under 16 years old
We don't know the ages of our users
assessmentQuestions.help: Children's data has special requirements including opt-in consent and parental consent

assessmentQuestions.question: Approximately how many consumer privacy requests do you receive monthly?
assessmentQuestions.help: This helps assess the scale of your consumer rights management needs

assessmentQuestions.question: What opt-out mechanisms do you currently provide?
choices: 'Do Not Sell My Personal Information' link on website
'Do Not Share My Personal Information' link on website
Limit Use of My Sensitive Personal Information option
We don't currently provide opt-out mechanisms
assessmentQuestions.help: CCPA requires specific opt-out mechanisms for sale and sharing of personal information

assessmentQuestions.question: Which third parties do you share personal information with?
choices: We don't share personal information with third parties
assessmentQuestions.help: Understanding data sharing helps determine sale/sharing obligations and disclosures needed

assessmentQuestions.question: How do you determine data retention periods for California consumers?
choices: We retain data indefinitely unless requested to delete
We don't have specific retention periods
assessmentQuestions.help: CCPA requires retention only for disclosed business purposes and reasonable periods

assessmentQuestions.question: How do you verify the identity of consumers making privacy requests?
choices: Email verification (send link to registered email)
We don't currently have verification procedures
assessmentQuestions.help: CCPA requires reasonable verification methods to protect consumer data

assessmentQuestions.question: Do you provide CCPA privacy rights to your employees?
choices: No, we rely on employment exemption
assessmentQuestions.help: Employee data has specific considerations under CCPA/CPRA

assessmentQuestions.question: Do you process personal information at the household level?
assessmentQuestions.help: Household data processing has specific notice and rights requirements

assessmentQuestions.question: Do you use automated decision-making that affects California consumers?
assessmentQuestions.help: Automated decision-making may require specific disclosures and opt-out rights

assessmentQuestions.question: Does your privacy policy include CCPA-required disclosures?
choices: Categories of sources of personal information
Business or commercial purposes for collection
Categories of third parties with whom we share
Categories of personal information sold or shared
Our privacy policy doesn't include these disclosures
assessmentQuestions.help: CCPA requires specific disclosures in privacy policies

assessmentQuestions.question: Do your service provider contracts include CCPA-required provisions?
choices: Yes, all contracts include CCPA provisions
We're in process of updating contracts
No, our contracts don't include CCPA provisions
We don't know what our contracts contain
assessmentQuestions.help: CCPA requires specific contractual provisions with service providers

show_if.not_contains: We don't share personal information with third parties

assessmentQuestions.question: Do you recognize and honor Global Privacy Control (GPC) signals?
choices: Yes, we automatically honor GPC signals
We recognize GPC but require additional verification
No, we don't currently honor GPC signals
We don't know what GPC is
assessmentQuestions.help: CPRA requires businesses to honor consumer preference signals like GPC

assessmentQuestions.question: Do you conduct privacy impact assessments for processing activities?
choices: Yes, for all significant processing activities
We don't know if PIAs are required
assessmentQuestions.help: PIAs help demonstrate compliance and identify privacy risks

categories.name: Notice Requirements
categories.description: Obligations to provide clear information to consumers about data collection and use

categories.name: Consumer Rights
categories.description: Rights that must be provided to consumers under CCPA/CPRA

categories.name: Opt-Out Requirements
categories.description: Requirements for opt-out mechanisms and processing opt-out requests

categories.name: Data Security Requirements
categories.description: Security measures and breach notification requirements

categories.name: Service Provider Requirements
categories.description: Contractual and operational requirements for service providers

categories.name: Children's Data Requirements
categories.description: Special requirements for processing children's personal information

requirements.title: Notice at collection of personal information
requirements.description: Businesses must inform consumers of data collection practices at or before collection
requirements.details: A business shall, at or before the point of collection of personal information, inform consumers of the categories of personal information to be collected and the purposes for which the categories of personal information are collected or used.

complianceChecks.description: Create notice at collection covering all required elements
Provide notice at point of data collection across all channels

requirements.title: Privacy policy covering CCPA requirements
requirements.description: Businesses must maintain comprehensive privacy policy with CCPA disclosures
requirements.details: A business shall maintain a privacy policy that includes information on consumers' rights under the CCPA, categories of personal information collected, sold, or disclosed, and other required disclosures.

complianceChecks.description: Update privacy policy with all CCPA-required disclosures
Ensure privacy policy is easily accessible from homepage

requirements.title: Just-in-time notice for mobile applications
requirements.description: Mobile apps must provide just-in-time notice for unexpected data collection
requirements.details: When a business collects personal information from a consumer's mobile device for a purpose that the consumer would not reasonably expect, it shall provide a just-in-time notice containing a summary of the categories of personal information being collected and a link to the full notice at collection.

complianceChecks.description: Implement just-in-time notices in mobile applications

requirements.title: Right to know about personal information collected, disclosed, or sold
requirements.description: Consumers have the right to request disclosure of business data practices
requirements.details: A consumer shall have the right to request that a business disclose the categories and specific pieces of personal information the business has collected about the consumer, the categories of sources from which the personal information is collected, the business purpose for collecting or selling personal information, and the categories of third parties with whom the business shares personal information.

complianceChecks.description: Implement process for handling know requests within 45 days
Maintain systems capable of providing comprehensive data disclosures

requirements.title: Right to delete personal information
requirements.description: Consumers have the right to request deletion of their personal information
requirements.details: A consumer shall have the right to request that a business delete any personal information about the consumer which the business has collected from the consumer.

complianceChecks.description: Implement deletion process considering legal exceptions
Ensure technical capability to delete data across all systems

requirements.title: Right to opt-out of sale of personal information
requirements.description: Consumers have the right to opt-out of the sale of their personal information
requirements.details: A consumer shall have the right, at any time, to direct a business that sells personal information about the consumer to third parties not to sell the consumer's personal information.

complianceChecks.description: Implement 'Do Not Sell My Personal Information' mechanism
Process opt-out requests and maintain opt-out status

requirements.title: Right to non-discrimination
requirements.description: Businesses cannot discriminate against consumers for exercising CCPA rights
requirements.details: A business shall not discriminate against a consumer because the consumer exercised any of the consumer's rights under the CCPA.

complianceChecks.description: Establish non-discrimination policies and training
Monitor for discriminatory practices in service delivery

requirements.title: Right to correct inaccurate personal information
requirements.description: Consumers have the right to request correction of inaccurate personal information
requirements.details: A consumer shall have the right to request a business that maintains inaccurate personal information about the consumer to correct that inaccurate personal information.

complianceChecks.description: Implement correction process for inaccurate data

requirements.title: Right to limit use and disclosure of sensitive personal information
requirements.description: Consumers have the right to limit use of their sensitive personal information
requirements.details: A consumer shall have the right to direct a business that collects sensitive personal information about the consumer to limit its use of the consumer's sensitive personal information.

complianceChecks.description: Implement 'Limit Use of My Sensitive Personal Information' mechanism

requirements.title: Do Not Sell My Personal Information link
requirements.description: Businesses must provide clear and conspicuous opt-out link
requirements.details: A business that sells consumers' personal information shall provide a clear and conspicuous link on the business's internet homepage, titled 'Do Not Sell My Personal Information,' to a web page that enables a consumer to opt out of the sale of the consumer's personal information.

complianceChecks.description: Add 'Do Not Sell My Personal Information' link to homepage
Create functional opt-out web page

requirements.title: Opt-out of sale request methods
requirements.description: Businesses must provide multiple methods for submitting opt-out requests
requirements.details: A business shall provide two or more designated methods for submitting requests to opt out of sale, including, at a minimum, an interactive webform accessible via a clear and conspicuous link titled 'Do Not Sell My Personal Information,' on the business's website or mobile application.

complianceChecks.description: Implement multiple opt-out request methods (web form, email, phone)

requirements.title: Opt-out of sharing for cross-context behavioral advertising
requirements.description: Businesses must provide opt-out mechanism for data sharing
requirements.details: A business that shares consumers' personal information for cross-context behavioral advertising shall provide a clear and conspicuous link titled 'Do Not Share My Personal Information' to allow consumers to opt out of the sharing of their personal information.

complianceChecks.description: Add 'Do Not Share My Personal Information' link to homepage

requirements.title: Reasonable security procedures and practices
requirements.description: Businesses must implement reasonable security measures
requirements.details: A business that collects personal information about a consumer shall implement reasonable security procedures and practices appropriate to the nature of the personal information to protect the personal information from unauthorized or illegal access, destruction, use, modification, or disclosure.

complianceChecks.description: Implement comprehensive security program appropriate to data types
Document security procedures and conduct regular assessments

requirements.title: Risk assessments for high-risk processing
requirements.description: Businesses must conduct risk assessments for certain processing activities
requirements.details: A business whose processing of consumers' personal information presents significant risk to consumers' privacy or security shall conduct a cybersecurity audit and submit a risk assessment to the California Privacy Protection Agency.

complianceChecks.description: Conduct and document cybersecurity audits and risk assessments

requirements.title: Service provider contracts
requirements.description: Businesses must enter into compliant contracts with service providers
requirements.details: A business that discloses personal information to a service provider shall enter into a written contract that prohibits the service provider from selling the personal information or retaining, using, or disclosing the personal information for any purpose other than the specific purpose of performing the services specified in the contract.

applicableWhen.not_contains: We don't share personal information with third parties

complianceChecks.description: Execute compliant service provider agreements
Monitor service provider compliance with contractual obligations

requirements.title: Third-party contracts
requirements.description: Businesses must ensure third parties comply with CCPA obligations
requirements.details: A business that sells or shares personal information with a third party shall enter into an agreement with the third party that requires the third party to comply with applicable obligations under the CPRA and provide the same level of privacy protection as required by the CPRA.

complianceChecks.description: Execute third-party agreements with CCPA compliance provisions

requirements.title: Opt-in consent for consumers under 16
requirements.description: Businesses must obtain opt-in consent for minors' data
requirements.details: A business shall not sell or share the personal information of consumers if the business has actual knowledge that the consumer is less than 16 years of age, unless the consumer, in the case of consumers at least 13 years of age and less than 16 years of age, or the consumer's parent or guardian, in the case of consumers who are less than 13 years of age, has affirmatively authorized the sale or sharing of the consumer's personal information.

complianceChecks.description: Implement age verification and opt-in consent mechanisms
System controls to prevent sale/sharing of children's data without consent

requirements.title: Knowledge standard for children under 16
requirements.description: Businesses that willfully disregard age are deemed to have actual knowledge
requirements.details: A business that willfully disregards the consumer's age shall be deemed to have had actual knowledge of the consumer's age.

complianceChecks.description: Implement reasonable age verification procedures

requirements.title: Consumer request verification
requirements.description: Businesses must verify consumer identity for privacy requests
requirements.details: A business shall use reasonable methods to verify the identity of a consumer making a request and ensure that the person making the request is the consumer about whom the business has collected information or that person's authorized agent.

complianceChecks.description: Implement reasonable verification procedures for consumer requests
System to match verification information with collected data

requirements.title: Consumer request response timeframes
requirements.description: Businesses must respond to consumer requests within specified timeframes
requirements.details: A business shall respond to a consumer request within 45 days of receiving the request. The response period may be extended once by an additional 45 days when reasonably necessary, provided the consumer is informed of the extension within the first 45-day period.

complianceChecks.description: Implement request tracking and response procedures within 45 days

requirements.title: Global Privacy Control (GPC) signal recognition
requirements.description: Businesses must honor opt-out preference signals
requirements.details: A business shall treat user-enabled global privacy controls, such as a browser plugin or privacy setting, device setting, or other mechanism, that communicate or signal the consumer's choice to opt out of the sale and sharing of personal information as a valid request to opt out.

complianceChecks.description: Implement Global Privacy Control signal detection and processing

requirements.title: Employee training on consumer rights
requirements.description: Businesses must train employees who handle consumer requests
requirements.details: A business shall train all individuals responsible for handling consumer inquiries about the business's privacy practices and consumer rights to be knowledgeable on all requirements and how to direct consumers to exercise their rights.

complianceChecks.description: Provide CCPA training to customer-facing employees
Document training programs and completion records
